description: Improve SEO and initial load performance using Nuxt.js and Server-Side Rendering (SSR).

slides.title: What is SSR?
slides.content:
# Rendering on the Server ðŸ–¥ï¸

**Client-Side Rendering (CSR):** Browser downloads empty HTML -> Downloads Vue -> Renders App. (Slow initial paint, bad for SEO).

**Server-Side Rendering (SSR):** Server runs Vue -> Generates full HTML -> Sends to Browser. (Fast initial paint, great for SEO).

slides.title: Hydration
slides.content:
# Hydration ðŸ’§

Once the server HTML arrives, the page is visible but **static** (buttons don't work yet).

Vue then loads on the client and "attaches" to the existing HTML, making it interactive. This process is called **Hydration**.

slides.title: Nuxt.js
slides.content:
# Nuxt â›°ï¸

Implementing SSR manually is hard.

Nuxt is a meta-framework built on top of Vue that handles SSR, routing, and code-splitting out of the box.

It is to Vue what Next.js is to React.

slides.title: Universal Rendering
slides.content:
# Universal Code ðŸŒ

Code that runs on BOTH server and client.

**Constraint:** You cannot access browser-specific APIs (like `window` or `document`) inside life-cycle hooks that run on the server (like `setup()` or `asyncData`).

slides.title: Static Site Generation (SSG)
slides.content:
# SSG ðŸ“¦

Pre-render pages at **build time** instead of request time.

Great for blogs and documentation.

Nuxt command: `npx nuxi generate`.

result: Pure HTML files that can be hosted on any static CDN (Netlify, Vercel).

slides.title: Data Fetching in Nuxt
slides.content:
# useFetch ðŸ“¨

Nuxt provides the `useFetch` composable.

It runs on the server during SSR (to fill HTML) and then hydrates the data to the client so it doesn't need to fetch it again.

```javascript
const { data } = await useFetch('/api/users')
```

slides.title: SEO
slides.content:
# Vue & SEO ðŸ”

Google bots struggle with JavaScript-heavy SPAs.

SSR provides fully rendered HTML content immediately, ensuring search engines can index your titles, meta tags (using `useHead`), and content perfectly.

slides.title: Server Routes
Auto Imports
slides.content:
# Developer Experience âœ¨

Nuxt auto-imports Vue functions (`ref`, `computed`) and your own components.

No need to write `import { ref } from 'vue'` at the top of every file.

slides.title: Summary
slides.content:
# Recap: SSR & Nuxt ðŸŽ“

Performance + SEO.

- **SSR:** Server builds HTML -> Client Hydrates.
- **SSG:** Build HTML once (deploy anywhere).
- **Nuxt:** The framework to make this easy.
- **Constraints:** No `window` on server.
